discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
1. MAC addresses can easily be spoofed, so MAB (MAC Authentication Bypass) offers lower security compared to 802.1X.
2. MAB must be configured on both the authenticator and the AAA server.
3. Web Authentication (WebAuth) can also serve as a fallback mechanism for 802.1X, especially for devices that do not support 802.1X but can display a web page.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct
https://networklessons.com/cisco/ccie-routing-switching-written/mac-authentication-bypass-mab

Selected Answer: A
It's defintely A

questions.question_text: In a Cisco SD-Access environment, which function is performed by the border node?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Function of Border Node in SD-Access:
1. Provides Layer 3 connectivity between the SD-Access fabric and external networks.
2. Routes traffic into and out of the fabric, ensuring communication between internal fabric devices and devices or services outside of the fabric.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/solutions/CVD/Campus/cisco-sda-design-guide.html

Selected Answer: D
Fabric border node: This fabric device (for example, core layer device) connects 
 external Layer 3 networks to the SDA fabric

Selected Answer: D
Seems correct

choices.C: Provide reachability information to fabric endpoints.
choices.A: Connect users and devices to the fabric domain.
choices.D: Provide connectivity to traditional Layer 3 networks.

questions.question_text: What is a characteristic of the overlay network in the Cisco SD-Access architecture?

choices.C: It uses a traditional routed access design to provide performance and high availability to the network.
choices.A: It provides multicast support to enable Layer 2 flooding capability in the underlay network.
choices.B: It provides isolation among the virtual networks and independence from the physical network.
choices.D: It consists of a group of physical routers and switches that are used to maintain the network.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
In Cisco SD-Access, the overlay network is designed to abstract and provide independence from the underlying physical network. It enables segmentation, policy enforcement, and logical network isolation without direct dependence on the physical network topology. This characteristic contributes to the flexibility and programmability of SD-Access.

Overlay network in SD-Access:
1. Create a virtual layer from the underlying physical network topology.
2. Can be modified, expanded, or updated without impacting the physical network. 
3. Support network segmentation and policy enforcement.
4. Provide logical isolation of network traffic

Selected Answer: B
B looks correct
B looks correct
https://study-ccnp.com/cisco-sd-access-architecture-network-layer/#:~:text=The%20overlay%20network%20is%20fully,the%20SD%2DAccess%20fabric%20operation.
